title: Los Angeles County Settles Lawsuits Linked to Kobe Bryant Helicopter Crash
sub_head: Board of Supervisors approves payments totaling $2.5 million to two families to settle legal actions over handling of crash-site photos by sheriffâ€™s deputies
body:
The Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors approved settlements totaling $2.5 million for two families whose loved ones died in the 2020 helicopter crash that also killed National Basketball Association superstar Kobe Bryant and his daughter, Gianna Bryant.
The settlements end lawsuits filed by the Mauser and Altobelli families. Matthew Mauser and his three children lost wife, mother and basketball coach Christina Mauser, 38 years old, in the crash. Siblings John James Altobelli and Alexis Altobelli lost their parents, John and Keri Altobelli, 56 and 46, respectively, and teenage sister Alyssa.
